name: Holiday Inn Macau

reviews.text: The room was spacious, the bathroom wonderful, the shower - great!
reviews.title: Excellent as Expected

reviews.text: The Restaurant was most excellent as the food was fresh.
reviews.title: very nice staff, too much smoking in Hotel

reviews.text: Friendly and helpful staff who remembered us even though it was our first time in this hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel.

reviews.text: Very friendly administration and other staff. Hotel has casino and not best place to stay with family.
reviews.title: Good location but hotel needs upgrade

reviews.text: This hotel is typical for what you'd expect from the holiday inn chain. Clean rooms with basic amenities. The price was reasonable for Macau. They have a casino, but it was very small with no slot machines and nowhere near the size of the big casinos in Macau. Nice comfortable bed, The location was great and only minutes away from the Wynn or MGM by foot. I would stay here again when I am in Macau!
reviews.title: staff at the front desk has a bad attitude and very rude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed one night here and weren't in room that much, but can say we used the free shuttle to and from the ferry terminal. It took a while to get the ferry when arriving in Macau, but didn't wait long when leaving. Location is pretty good. Once you get your bearings, you can walk to all the main tourism sites in Macau. It's close to the Grand Lisboa and the Wynn. From the Grand Lisboa, it's easy to catch a city bus that will drop you off at the Venetian casinos on the other island. Breakfast was offered at a discount, but we didn't try it. It was very smoky in the hotel's casino. This casino was really for locals; don't think they even had slot machines, just smoky table games and mah jong.
reviews.title: Not exciting but recommended

reviews.text: The Hotel, while well situated has very unfriendly Chinese staff, notably to mention one that stands out more than the rest, namely the fri=ont desk clerk by the name of DILON. He is outright rude and has no manners - beware of him. The positive not eis that the entire Filipino staff is extremly friendly and helpful! Guenter Taus
reviews.title: Very unfriendly Front desk clerk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay here was fine. We had a suite with a comfortable king-size bed that helped us quickly overcome our jetlag from after a long flight from the U.S. The room and furniture were a bit dated and rough around the edges, but we didn't plan to spend much time in the room anyway, so that was easily overlooked. The location allowed for easy exploration of the city. It was only blocks from larger casinos and historic areas, so we walked most places during our long weekend here. A shuttle runs regularly to the ferry terminal, making connections to casinos and shopping on the other island simple. Breakfast was included in the hotel price for us. There was a large selection of food and friendly staff in the restaurant. The front-desk staff and concierge also were helpful throughout the stay. As others have mentioned, smoking is allowed in public areas, so we had to dodge smelly clouds of smoke while waiting for elevators. The main negative was a gross, moldy bathmat in our bathroom. C'mon, Holiday Inn! How tough is it to replace or clean a bathmat?
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable

reviews.text: The only negative thing I can say about this Holiday Inn is that it was kinda cold inside the building. Smoking is allowed within most places in macau so if this bothers you then finding a hotel is going to be a bit of a problem for you. The rooms are nice and spacious with comfortable beds. Hotel staff I found to be friendly and most of them speak very good english and are glad to be of any help. Food at the restaurants isnt too bad either but there are some better places to grab a feed outside the hotel. There is also a pool and hot tub as well as a spa centre, useful for those needing some stress relief. The hotel is conveniently located as well being located a couple of minutes away from grand lisboa, wynn and mgm to name a few as well as a couple of minutes away from most bars and nightclubs. Maybe if your a pain to deal with and treat the hotel staff with little respect, you might be one of these people complaining about this hotel.
reviews.title: Not sure I understand where the complaints are coming from

reviews.text: I had a very good experience with other Holiday Inn Hotels and Resorts. However Holiday Inn in Macau was horribly different. I reserved the renovated deluxe room. They charged us for breakfast that we had evidence from them in an email that the breakfast was for two. They charged us tourism charges which I have never seen before. The price difference between online price estimate and actual charge was much more expensive than priority club due to additional charges called tourism charge and other charges. This was in addition to tax charges. Quality of service was poor no phone calls answered for room service after 10-11pm. I booked two rooms. My guest in another room had the same feeling that the service was poor. During check out they did not let me pay earlier and drop the key cards. they told me that rooms should be evacuated and investigated first. The breakfast the person in charge of egg station was never ever there. Pool is very small compare to other hotels in Macau. Internet is NOT for free although it says in room wifi access but you have to pay for it. Staff are not so friendly. If you want to go to Macau stay away from this hotel. I have been travelling to Macau for years and you should go somewhere that you can enjoy Macau Truly.
reviews.title: you can find better

reviews.text: It's located in the heart of the main casinos. We spent 3 days 2 nights in macau. There is a casino inside the hotel itself. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. They can speak good English. Most of the hotel in macau provide free shuttle bus service to access ferry terminal. This hotel has the same facility also. It's within walking distance to reach St. Paolo (Da Sam Ba), lisboa casino, grand lisboa, wynn, star wolrd, fortuna, etc. It's very convenient. Very pleasant stay in this hotel. Strongly recommend. Worth for money. There are many restaurant nearby.
reviews.title: Recommended stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights. They have free shutle services from ferry terminal to hotel and vv.Room was OK , nothing special. Indoor swimming pool was nice. We had buffet lunch for 70 HKG is a fair price for what you get. Two times diners a la carte and the food was very good as was the service from the staff.Macau is all about gambling but the casino's and shops are a tourist atraction themselves.Macau is a nice side trip from Hong Kong but max 2 nights than you have seen it all. Be aware under 18 you are not allowed in the casino's
reviews.title: Good for short break

reviews.text: Smoking is allowed then is easy to understand environment in the hotel. It a hotel for people that Is looking for gambling. We had dinner in the first night at the hotel restaurant and it was not a good experience! Breakfast variety is limited. Concierge service was efficient. Localization is very good, but for my family( with 2 kids) for sure not anymore.
reviews.title: Not for a family

reviews.text: Great location! We travelled to Macau for a few days between 5 star hong kong hotel and 6 star Brunei hotel. The hotel facilities are a little dated, but who cares with staff like Mark conciege Henry and Garry in the bar. Gym is great plunge pools spectacular. Service during our 3 day stay was the best we had out of entire trip. Well done.
reviews.title: Better service than 5 star hotels

reviews.text: First I would like to thank all the tripadvisor reviewers because your information on the matter was very useful. As a result - no overrated expectations, I was ready for this Macau hotel experience.
reviews.title: Smoking lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is within 10 minutes walking distance from Star World Casino with the Wynn right next door. Walking to the MGM may take about 20 minutes or so.
reviews.title: Fair Location, Impossibel to Get a Taxi

reviews.text: The only problem with this hotel is really the location is off-set on a back street and it is very difficult to get a taxi without calling for one first. I thought this was odd, but it turns out Macau in general is generally a big challenge when trying to get a taxi off the street. Most of the time we waited in long taxi lines at the major hotels to get around. When we did call a taxi, we didn't have a problem. Just note to yourself it's probably best to just call a taxi in Macau rather than walk around trying to find a good spot to grab one off the street.
reviews.title: I like it!

reviews.text: Other than that, the TV didn't work in our room and we got upgraded. I couldn't complain about that. I didn't check out the casino at this hotel or any of the restaurants. I basically stayed here since it was one of the only hotels with a reasonable room rate that still had availability for the weekend we were going.
reviews.title: Central location

reviews.text: Also the hotel does not have a shuttle service from the Gong Bei border with China, we just hopped in a taxi to get to the hotel from the border. Not a big deal but next time I'll probably stay at one of the larger hotels as they seem to have more services available to guests.
reviews.title: Great hotel with good services!

reviews.text: The Holiday Inn at Macau is a very good average hotel with value for your money. Almost in the middle of the centre and everything on walkingdistance. Very kind and helpfull staff. Clean and good rooms for a hotel in that priceclass and location. Good breakfast and diner. In November i go to macau again (for the 3 time) and take again the Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: Nice Calm & Cool Hotel - Centrally located, Near all major attractions

description: Centrally located in the new business district, the Holiday Inn Macau is the only international four-star property in this vibrant city. Close to both the Macau-Hong Kong Ferry Terminal and the city centre, the hotel is accessible by public transportation. With its recent refurbishment, the hotel has a contemporary design providing a very friendly and casual atmosphere.
